pageContext.claim: “America lost nearly 10,000 factories while Biden was Vice President.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump is cherry-picking data that relies in the fact that Barack Obama took office in the middle of the Great Recession. There was a gain of 10,000 "factories" -- technically “manufacturing establishments," 80 percent of them with five or less people -- in Obama's second term. The loss of 200,000 jobs depends on whether you start counting the start of the term in January or February. (A president takes office on Jan. 20, but the data is collected the week of the 12th.) Trump starts with January. But if you start counting in February, as many economists recommend, Obama over eight years actually had a modest gain in manufacturing jobs — 4,000.
